response.answer_text: I'd give myself the power to grant wishes! Then I'd wish for more magical powers! Ahahaha! But of course, ’tis but a loophole that's illegal in the wishing universe. So instead, I'd give myself the ability to negotiate flawlessly (a sort of mind control, if you will). Why? I could always get what I want from anyone. Gotta have some selfish reason, right? I could encourage people to do things they normally wouldn't do, like studying or stop procrastinating. I could convince people to improve on our community and daily lives. This power would allow me to perform a multitude of tasks, from a small thing such as making that thief give back what he stole to something grand, like pushing the world to reform. Of course, I'd have to gain the popularity first, but hey, I've got mind control. I can force people to increase my popularity. Let us decrease militarization! Let us research more science and technology! Let us start that Energy Revoluion to get out of fossil fuels! Let us clean the world! Let us spend some more time educating the unfortunate! Let us have an era of world peace and prosperity! Let us make steps to colonize other worlds! Let us join as one to conquer our problems together. Let us improve humanity. And that's why I believe that superb negation/mind control is the best. My magical power can unite everyone for one cause. If one person can't do it, I'm sure seven billion people can. We are stronger together than apart.

Hmmm…. Although it would be nice to be rich I don’t need money and certainly get by. I would have to have a power that could help this world somehow. I think that it would be an incredible gift to grant people insight into themselves and their actions… self-understanding, as it were.  Why do I cut people off or give them the finger?Why do I strive for success at the cost of relationships?Why am I…. why do I….. (fill in the blank)It might not always change behavior but I think that it would change a lot, and that people would start being both nicer to each other AND would be able to take the necessary spiritual, emotional, physical, and social steps to improve themselves. It would also be an incredibly hard journey for some people. ——- (Hmmm… as I type this, I was just struck by a possible negative motivation of MY OWN for having this power. Granting self-understanding could be a form of revenge because people receiving this gift from my magical power would have to start to come to terms with who they really are and what they have done. Is it possible that I’m not really altruistic at all but instead am a clever psychopath who enjoys torturing people’s psyches? Wonder if I should use my power on myself?

Flying, always flying. Every time flying. I’ve wanted to fly since I was tiny, and not just regular “kids-like-to-jump-off-sofas” kinda flying, like I full on believed I could fly if I thought hard enough or got the right height or something. I still believe it. My old bedroom window looked like this:  (Sorry about the quality, closest I could find) except slightly wider and longer. I would climb up onto the top third of my window and push it open and dangle off, half of my body inside, the other half swinging over the street below. I was so certain I could fly, I tried to jump so many times (thank god the next door neighbour was good friends with my mum and so they would often smoke on the doorstep and she’d see me and scream at me to get back inside before I broke my skull). I used to have dreams of leaping off rooftops and falling a little before I’d shoot up into the sky, I still dream of flying now, just less frequently. I remember being captivated by Peter Pan and I absolutely adored the flying scenes where they’d leap and swim out of their windows and drift over the clouds and around buildings, I have a slight feeling that’s where my obsession came from. But in short, flying. I’d love to be able to just step into the air and fly away.

Invisibility.  Can you imagine how much fun it would be to just be a voyeur on the world;  observation, without participation.  Not having a personal dynamic in a situation, but being part of what is going on by just being able to observe surreptitiously, would be an amazing adventure.   Think of the things you could do and see and experience without anyone even knowing (or stopping you).  I could sit in the President’s office and hear exactly what is going on. I could visit famous people and see how they really live and what they really talk about.  The doors would be open (and free) to almost any place you could think of!  Although I suppose occasionally there would be a little matter of sneaking through security that would need to be thought through.   I could visit amazing places in the middle of a dark night and not worry about being a victim of crime.  If no one can see you, why not stow away on a cruise ship and take a trip around the world.  One problem that I see with this is that I would still have mass, so I could be sleeping on the deck of the ship when some unwitting sailor trips over me.  Although, since this is ‘magical’, maybe the mass problem can be imagined away.  The other problem is someone with no integrity having the same powers, might not have the same desire to just quietly ‘observe’ the world.

There is a right answer to this question. There is a BEST superpower. The power to control time. Most superpowers involve super enhancement of an already human ability, i.e. super strength, super speed, etc. Other powers allow one to perform impossible feats such as controling certain elements. But the power to CONTROL TIME allows for many things: Firstly, you could stop the aging process for yourself and be immortal, until such time as you decide that you should die (so you’re not stuck living forever no matter what). Secondly, it is essentially the same as teleportation, as you can stop time, and move from one place to another, then when time starts again you appear to have teleported from the perspective of someone else. Third, you can increase/decrease the flow of time, meaning if you wanted to travel to the future you could do so. There is something you can’t do with this power, though. There are many theories as to what would happen if one were to go back in time, but a lot of them are unsavory (e.g. the Butterfly Effect). But imagine… at that point there are not many superheroes who can hold a candle to you.
